Key Match Events: Lionel Messi and Julian Alvarez scored goals for Argentina
Canada fell behind in the 22nd minute on Argentina's first shot on target
Canada's coach Jesse Marsch received a caution in the 77th minute for voicing displeasure with officiating
Alphonso Davies had to leave in the 71st minute due to a hard tackle by Gonzalo Montiel
Pre-Game Insights: Canada heads to Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte for Saturday's third-place game
Canada beat No. 31 Peru 1-0 and tied No. 40 Chile 0-0 to finish second in Group A behind the Argentines
The Canadian men beat No. 99 Trinidad and Tobago 2-1 in a March playoff to make the 16-country field — as the 11th-ranked team at the tournament
Drake placed a $300,000 bet on Canada to win, a wager returning $2.88 million if successful
Post-Match Reflections: Messi praised the Argentina national team's performance
Canada's coach Jesse Marsch described the competition as very difficult, competitive, bad surfaces, and excessive heat
Miscellaneous Highlights: The loud crowd was largely clad in Argentina blue although there were pockets of red
Canada captain Alphonso Davies had to leave in the 71st minute after being injured in a hard tackle by Gonzalo Montiel that went unpunished
There was some bad blood late in the game, with Argentina upset at Canadian midfielder Ismael Kone petulantly kicking the ball into one of their fallen players
MetLife Stadium’s temporary grass surface appeared heavy, with water splashing and sand popping up during dribbles
